entry.name: G-quadruplex
entry.full: A three dimensional structure consisting of tetrads of G's connected by Hoogsteen bonds. Each tetrad is formed by taking one G from each G-tract. The size of the G-tract determines the number of tetrads found in the quadruplex.
entry.brief: A three dimensional structure consisting of tetrads of G's connected by Hoogsteen bonds.

entry.name: QGRS
entry.full: GRS that have the potential to form G-quadruplex. The pattern for a QGRS is four tracts of G's connected by arbitrary bases between each tract.
entry.brief: G-Rich Sequence that has the potential to form a G-quadruplex.

entry.name: GRS
entry.full: General term for a G-Rich Sequence.
entry.brief: General term for a G-Rich Sequence.

entry.name: G-Tract
entry.full: The set of G's that form a tetrad, the foundation for the G-quadruplex structure. There are four such tracts in a quadruplex. Each tract will be of the same size in a particular quadruplex, and in any case must contain at least two G's.
entry.brief: The set of G's that form a tetrad, the foundation for the G-quadruplex structure.

entry.name: G-Tetrad
entry.full: Square co-planar arrays of four guanine bases each within the G-quadruplex. Stabilized by Hoogsteen hydrogen bonding between the guanine bases. The G-quadruplex structure is composed of stacked G-tetrads.
entry.brief: Square co-planar arrays of four guanine bases each within the G-quadruplex.

entry.name: Gap or Loop
entry.full: The part of a QGRS that lies between two G-tracts. For example, in the QGRS, (GG)GTA(GG)C(GG)TGA(GG), the four G-tracts are in parentheses, so the three gaps are GTA, C, TGA. Note: up to one gap may be of length zero.
entry.brief: The part of a QGRS that lies between two G-groups.

entry.name: G-Score
entry.full: Each QGRS is assigned a score based on a system which rewards an arrangement of 'G's that is likely to form a stable unimolecular quadruplex. For calculation of G-scores, the size and distribution of the gaps in the predicted QGRS is taken into consideration. Also, the larger the size of the G-tracts, the higher the score. The computed G-scores are dependent on the user selected maximum QGRS length. The highest possible G-score, using the default maximum QGRS length of 45, and other restrictions, is 180.
entry.brief: Evaluates the likelihood of a QGRS to form a stable G-quadruplex structure.

entry.name: Non-overlapping QGRS
entry.full: Two sequences are said to be non-overlapping if their positions in the nucleotide sequence do not overlap.
entry.brief: Two sequences are said to be non-overlapping if their positions in the nucleotide sequence do not overlap.

entry.name: Overlapping QGRS
entry.full: Two QGRS are said to overlap if their positions in the nucleotide sequence overlap.
entry.brief: Two QGRS are said to overlap if their positions in the nucleotide sequence overlap.

entry.name: Homology Score
entry.full: The Homology Score evaluates a pair of QGRS on two aligned homologous nucleotide sequences for their evolutionary conservation. The scoring assigns the following weightages: 65% for QGRS overlap on the aligned sequences, 20% to tetrad similarity, 10% for loop length similarity, and 5% for the total length similarity between QGRS pairs. Homology score ranges between 0 and 1, where 1 indicates a very high level of evolutionary conservation
entry.brief: Evaluates a pair of QGRS on two aligned orthologous nucleotide sequences for their evolutionary conservation.

entry.name: Principal mRNA
entry.full: The nucleotide sequence which is identified by the user as primary.
entry.brief: The nucleotide sequence which is identified by the user as primary.

entry.name: Comparison mRNA
entry.full: The nucleotide sequence which will be aligned and compared to the primary mRNA sequence.
entry.brief: The nucleotide sequence which will be aligned and compared to the primary mRNA sequence.

entry.name: Semi-Global Alignment
entry.full: A global pairwise sequence alignment (such as by the method of Needleman and Wunsch) which, however, does not penalize the terminal gaps. This method is useful for a meaningful comparison of homoogous mRNA sequences which have significantly different lengths of UTRs (Untranslated Regions).
entry.brief: A pairwise sequence alignment that does not penalize the terminal gaps.

entry.name: CDS
entry.full: Region of the mRNA which codes for a protein.
entry.brief: Region of the mRNA which codes for a protein.

entry.name: 5' UTR
entry.full: Untranslated Region of the mRNA upstream of the CDS.
entry.brief: Untranslated Region of the mRNA upstream of the CDS.

entry.name: 3' UTR
entry.full: Untranslated Region of the mRNA downstream of the CDS.
entry.brief: Untranslated Region of the mRNA downstream of the CDS.

entry.name: mRNA ID
entry.full: The number corresponding to the accession number of a specific mRNA on the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) Database.
entry.brief: The number corresponding to the accession number of a specific mRNA on the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) Database.

entry.name: Gene Symbol
entry.full: A unique abbreviation of a gene name formally assigned by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
entry.brief: A unique abbreviation of a gene name formally assigned by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.

entry.name: Sequence Similarity
entry.full: A percentage value computed for a pair of aligned mRNA sequence homologs that assesses the similarity of the nucleotide sequence.
entry.brief: A percentage value computed for a pair of aligned mRNA sequence homologs that assesses the similarity of the nucleotide sequence.

entry.name: QGRS ID
entry.full: A unique number corresponding to a specific QGRS in the QGRS-H Database. It is derived by association with the mRNA ID of the nucleotide sequence on which the specific QGRS is located.
entry.brief: A unique number corresponding to a specific QGRS in the QGRS-H Database. It is derived by association with the mRNA ID of the nucleotide sequence on which the specific QGRS is located.

entry.name: Nt position
entry.full: Refers to the nucleotide location of the QGRS in its parent mRNA sequence.
entry.brief: Refers to the nucleotide location of the QGRS in its parent mRNA sequence.
